text:
Hey Tricia, we don't currently have a React component that will render an image with srcset


That ImageField component is just for defining it as part of your fields.jsx (the associated field value should have useful data like `src`, etc so you can render your own <img> tag

<@U04DLJH3W94> Thanks! I figured out the issue last night. We're using Chakra image components, and something about using a React component doesn't allow HubSpot to generate the `srcset`. I was able to force Chakra to render their React Image component as a native `img` tag, and `srcset` is working now, given that I use width and height on the html attributes. Thanks for your answer! :smile:
Just to check in, was there any planned resolution for the type error on the `?island` imports?  ts-ignore works, I’m just curious if it’s in the todo list or already solved.
